snippet: A court in Toulon, France, said the German quality-control company TUV Rheinland had “failed its obligation” to check the implants before issuing safety certificates.
abstract: French court orders TUV Rheinland, German quality-control company, to pay 1,600 victims of defective breast implants made by French company Poly Implants Prostheses about $4,000 each.
lead_paragraph: A court in Toulon, France, said the German quality-control company TUV Rheinland had “failed its obligation” to check the implants before issuing safety certificates.

headline.main: Court Orders German Firm to Pay Victims of Defective Breast Implants
headline.print_headline: France: Ruling in Breast Implant Case
